name: politico
text:
As states certify their election results, President-elect Biden is building an administration. Transition Playbook tracks the appointments, people, and the emerging power centers of the new administration. Stay in the know, subscribe today.
https://t.co/0fP2W0nPkz https://t.co/mElUxUraYi

name: politico
text:
Sen. Lamar Alexander today said he opposes President Trump's nomination of Judy Shelton to the Federal Reserve, a further sign that the Republican leadership has little room for error in getting the controversial nominee confirmed

https://t.co/J4FSGAFgLV

name: politico
text: President-elect Joe Biden pressed the Trump administration to share more details about how it intends to allocate Covid-19 vaccinations, while also accusing the president of putting lives at risk by refusing to coordinate with his team https://t.co/Z3rrWHkEYI https://t.co/lfKdLpxMvU

name: politico
text: A new wave of coronavirus cases is causing a surge of hospitalizations and more than 1,000 deaths per day. What sho… https://t.co/3KEVap62gO

name: politico
text:
The Republican Party is in an increasingly untenable position — how much longer can it really refuse to recognize Joe Biden as the president-elect?
https://t.co/riUEbXCJws

name: politico
text:
Not every political operative can celebrate their 50th birthday with the governor of America’s most populous state during a pandemic.

Not every political operative is Jason Kinney.

https://t.co/QK40ZDFrRM

name: politico
text:
The nation’s divide over mask-wearing exploded on the Senate floor this evening. 

The moment was a rare public disagreement over the way the Senate is being run during the pandemic. 

https://t.co/VwInMAOJbG

name: politico
text: Donald Trump's flirtation with another run for president is already making problems for the Republicans preparing for 2024 https://t.co/YfnyVmrMPz

name: politico
text:
Opinion: Don’t worry about the thin squealing you hear wafting in from the White House. 

It’s just the sound of the last thousand cubic meters of gas escaping the rapidly deflating Trump presidency.

https://t.co/WMgM71IiLo

name: politico
text: Georgia’s Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger said today that Sen. Lindsey Graham implicitly proposed he toss out legally mailed ballots in his state https://t.co/vHRDfAmYSN

name: politico
text: Rep. Cedric Richmond — a Louisiana Democrat and national co-chair of Joe Biden’s presidential campaign — is planning to leave his congressional seat for the White House to take on a senior adviser role focused on public engagement  https://t.co/dLdXkC5jgl

name: politico
text: The Justice Department says it has effectively run out the clock on the House’s effort to compel testimony from former White House counsel Don McGahn, a star witness to alleged obstruction of justice by President Donald Trump https://t.co/I4cEXv7VAv

name: politico
text: The pandemic may have "canceled" 2020, but it did not derail an annual gathering of lobbyists and lawmakers on the shores of Maui that brought people from across the country to a luxury resort this week https://t.co/rPrZleb7cu

name: politico
text: When dozens of national leaders gather online in December to press ahead with a new stage of the Paris climate agreement, the U.S. won’t be at the table: The Trump administration has left the agreement, while Joe Biden and his transition team can’t attend https://t.co/uyu5iOFvJ9

name: politico
text:
Tune in to POLITICO Dispatch to hear from experts across our newsroom break down the most important stories of the day. Subscribe and start listening today.
https://t.co/DPUpEFlsul https://t.co/Jc6Q8YdIky

name: politico
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and her top deputies are running unopposed, but Democrats are looking ahead to a post-Pelosi future https://t.co/ZvWkxnyD2G

name: politico
text: This is the year Black Lives Matter grew from a grassroots agitator to a potential political powerhouse. And with Joe Biden as president-elect, its leaders are seeking to expand their influence beyond the streets — and into the corridors of Washington. https://t.co/SiDy5DFajo

name: politico
text: Stocks popped again after Moderna said its vaccine was over 94% effective, adding to the good news from last week from Pfizer and BioNTech. Once again, stocks that will benefit from a strong in-person economy rose and stay-at-home stocks like Netflix slid. https://t.co/xGPza8nWfc

name: politico
text:
RT @POLITICOEurope: How come Europe and the US haven't managed to introduce systems that will keep the coronavirus at bay whilst simultaneously enabling economies to go on?

@DavidNabarro, special envoy on COVID-19 to the director general of the World Health Organization, has a few thoughts on that. https://t.co/hIG5oJjhZWHow come Europe and the US haven't managed to introduce systems that will keep the coronavirus at bay whilst simult… https://t.co/LTnCABALpC

name: politico
text: There are no conversations right now about another round of Covid relief. None. The White House is silent. The Hill is quiet. That means no new programs, no new money for Americans before the holiday season. https://t.co/HY07KiGXtW

name: politico
text:
RT @burgessev: Sen. Brown: “I start by asking the presiding officer to wear a mask.”

Sen. Sullivan: “I don’t wear a mask when I’m speaking ... I don’t need your instruction.”

https://t.co/LRpnes9pkb

name: politico
text: How much longer can the GOP refuse to recognize Joe Biden as president-elect? With Trump's legal challenges crumbling, states getting closer to certifying their election results, and Biden's transition stuck in limbo, it appears to be: not much longer. https://t.co/iuNzlUbfKe

name: politico
text: The nation’s divide over mask-wearing exploded on the Senate floor on Monday evening when Sen. Sherrod Brown (D-Ohio) took aim at Sen. Dan Sullivan (R-Alaska), who was presiding over the Senate https://t.co/TCEW1PFWlo https://t.co/JZoMQDpK0R

name: politico
text: The moment was a rare public disagreement over the way the Senate is being run during the pandemic. Though Democrats have complained about the Senate’s agenda, they’ve rarely publicly criticized members of the GOP over masks in such a direct fashion. https://t.co/TCEW1PFWlo

name: politico
text: This month’s election has Republican and Democratic lawmakers more at odds than ever over what role — if any — social media companies should play in patrolling contentious political disputes online https://t.co/X57vMAJ9xY

name: politico
text: RT @kelmej: Ouch- Sen. Sherrod Brown tells #SEC Chairman Jay Clayton that "you've changed the rules so much, even you will need to relearn fundamental elements of security laws when you return to what I assume will be a lucrative private practice."Ouch- Sen. Sherrod Brown tells #SEC Chairman Jay Clayton that "you've changed the rules so much, even you will need… https://t.co/7BKEGwcngo

name: politico
text: RT @JakeSherman: TEAM BIDEN will announce a slate of their senior staff today: Anthony Bernal, sr adviser to Jill Biden … Mike Donilon, sr adviser to Joe Biden … Jen O’Malley Dillon, deputy COS … Dana Remus, counsel to Biden … Julissa Reynoso Pantaleon, COS to Jill BidenTEAM BIDEN will announce a slate of their senior staff today: Anthony Bernal, sr adviser to Jill Biden … Mike Donil… https://t.co/WcWfMtCKqG

name: politico
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey are now testifying before the Senate Judiciary panel. This marks Zuckerberg's third appearance before Congress in 2020 alone. https://t.co/X57vMAJ9xY

name: politico
text: Sen. Richard Blumenthal (D-Conn.) plans to use his opening remarks to call on Facebook and Twitter to take more aggressive steps to crack down on misleading content, while ripping Republicans for dedicating the hearing to allegations of political bias https://t.co/Y0SEaG0qsP

name: politico
text: The CEOs of Twitter and Facebook will again tell Senate lawmakers they are open to changing a key set of legal protections that shield online companies from lawsuits over the content they host https://t.co/Y0SEaG0qsP

name: politico
text:
Most Brits — 64 percent, to be precise — approved of the EU’s handling of the coronavirus pandemic.

That's a much higher approval rating than what they gave their OWN government, which stands at 46 percent. https://t.co/P1wvAidtiI

name: politico
text: Joe Biden is filling his White House with loyalists who served in key roles in his campaign and, in some cases, worked alongside him during the Obama administration https://t.co/rAqZdjLryw

name: politico
text: The Biden transition team announced a series of staff moves today, including that longtime adviser and confidant Mike Donilon will move to the White House as senior adviser to the president https://t.co/rAqZdjLryw

name: politico
text: Today's announcement joins yesterday's appointments of Rep. Cedric Richmond (D-La.) as senior adviser to the president and of the White House Office of Public Engagement and former campaign manager Jen O’Malley Dillon as deputy chief of staff https://t.co/rAqZdjLryw

name: politico
text: The race to be the next top Republican on the House Armed Services Committee is turning into a three-way contest between some of the panel’s most vocal defense hawks https://t.co/i4HC06V2KA

name: politico
text: Twitter chief executive Jack Dorsey told the senators that social media companies need to be more transparent about the reason they label or remove posts, particularly as an increasing number of those decisions are made without human input https://t.co/Y0SEaG0qsP

name: politico
text: Trump’s personal attorney Rudy Giuliani has filed a petition in federal court to represent the Trump campaign in its controversial lawsuit seeking to challenge election results in Pennsylvania https://t.co/1A5Hi1ZCl0

name: politico
text: "You pointed out that we are facing something that feels impossible," Dorsey told Graham. "We are required to help increase the health of the public conversation, while, at the same time, ensuring that as many people as possible can participate." https://t.co/xvYcAqPSQe https://t.co/yHbQlivyOy

name: politico
text: Raffensperger told CNN he took Graham’s comments as “an implication of look hard and see how many ballots you could throw out” https://t.co/44lHeszYdz

name: politico
text:
Democrat Sen. Richard Blumenthal turned his fire on Senate Republicans.

“This hearing is not a serious one. It is a political sideshow — a public tar and feathering,” he said. https://t.co/5rAQCvFIpq https://t.co/XzOiCPOmwV

name: politico
text: Blumenthal also said that “a series of hearings on big tech is long overdue on antitrust issues, on privacy concerns and Section 230,” the law that shields them from lawsuits for hosting user content  https://t.co/5rAQCvFIpq

name: politico
text: For the record: This replaces a deleted tweet that incorrectly described Sen. Richard Blumenthal's role in the Senate Judiciary Committee
